forumNotes.author: gray
forumNotes.content:
I have made a new FBWF GUI.  

Almost all functions in fbwfmgr is available.   
You may even commit files.  
For those interrested, Please test it.  
Available in 32bit and 64 bit versions.   
I have only testet it in Win 7 , 32bit.  

Download available for the next 24 hours from,  
[http://87.59.156.230/](http://87.59.156.230/ "External link")  

Get it from the download folder.  

Regards Gray.

forumNotes.author: MedEvil
forumNotes.content:
In what language did you write it?  
The Ram use seems to be a bit on the big side for a simple gui interface.  

![:whistling:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/happy22.gif)

forumNotes.author: gray
forumNotes.content:
Written in Autoit.,  
And the ram usage may depend on your fbwf configuration,  
it keeps track of a lot of info , depending on the above.   
But I will check it, and see if i can minimize it.   

Regards Gray.

forumNotes.author: MedEvil
forumNotes.content:
No need to waste time, optimizing. The size is fine for an Autoit application.  
Besides it is meant to be used with a real full blown OS and not a PE, so size it not as critical.  

![:whistling:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/happy22.gif)

forumNotes.author: gray
forumNotes.content:
Take it as a compliment :-)  
AutoIt uses a lot of storage , I need a lot of includes for this.  
But I like AutoIt , it only took 10 hours to write this.   
And you are right NOT for PE, but for USB booting a real protected system..   
I am going to develop it a bit further , when a have the time,   
there are a few things missing, and some could be better, but there are no  
alternatives on the web, command line interface works, but are boring and  
time consuming.  
Hope you can use it .....  

Regards Kim.

forumNotes.author: gray
forumNotes.content:
New and hopefully final version will be available for  
download tonight.  

Minor changes to the code, and new functions applied.  
I think i am covering it all now.  

The current 64bit edition is in error, and will also be replaced tonight.  

Regards Gray

forumNotes.content: I am interested in this! Is it possible for me to get a copy somehow? The download link seems to be down now...

forumNotes.author: gray
forumNotes.content:
Yes I am interested, if you want to share, you need a webhost.  
I can get my own webserver up running, but normally it is  
used for something else.   

Regards Gray.

forumNotes.author: gray
forumNotes.content:
Sorry,  
Just found out the version uploaded had a problem in Win Xp,  
New version uploaded and verified in both Win 7 and Win Xp.   
Please download it again.  

Regards Gray.

forumNotes.author: pscEx
forumNotes.content:
Right!  

Now it starts under my XP ![:wodoo:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/wodoo.gif)   

Peter

forumNotes.author: gray
forumNotes.content:
Well yes,  
seems to be a problem about where you compile autoit scripts  
needed to be compiled from win 7 (32b) , to work in Win Xp (32b)  
The first version was compiled in Win Server 2003 (32b) and worked in Win 7,  
tested this in Win Server 2008 (32b and 64b) , the 32b edition worked in both,   
but the 64b edition did not work in 2008 (64b) , this must be some sort of an autoit bug.  
Regards Gray.
